com.camerontec.catalys.util.notification

Interface INotifySupport

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IConnectionPointConfiguration, ISessionFactory
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConnectionPointConfigInMemory, DefaultNotifySupport, SessionFactory

    public interface INotifySupport
    All purpose support for event sources.

    By plugging in different implementations of this we can have different types of listener management.

    Follows the source-support-listener pattern as described in the excellent "Java Design" by Coad, Mayfield and Kern, Yourdon Press, 1999.

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        void addListener(EventListener listener)
        Register a listener which is automatically removed if it throws an exception when notified.

        Equivalent to: 

         addListener(listener, true);
        Parameters:
        listener - a listener

      • addListener

        void addListener(EventListener listener,
                 boolean removeOnException)
        Register given listener.

        If the listener throws an exception when it is notified, it will be automatically removed if removeOnException is true.

        Parameters:
        listener - a listener
        removeOnException - whether to remove the listener after it throws an exception

      • hasListener

        boolean hasListener(EventListener listener)
        Determines whether the specified listener is registered.
        Parameters:
        listener - a listener
        Returns:
        true or false

      • removeListener

        Unregister given listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - a listener
        Returns:
        True if the listener was found.

      • fireNotify

        List<ListenerExceptionEntry> fireNotify(EventObject event,
                                        int minListeners)
        Sends event to all listeners.

        If the event was sent to fewer than minListeners then that will be regarded as an error. In that case, a non null list will be returned containing an appropriate ListenerExceptionEntry.

        If a listener throws an exception when it is notified, that exception is returned in a List (because there may be more than one listener, we may need to return more than one Exception).
        If a listener's removeOnException attribute is true, then if that listener throws an exception it will automatically be removed.

        Parameters:
        event - Event to be sent to listeners.
        minListeners - Minimum number of listeners.
        Returns:
        List of any ListenerExceptionEntry recording the exceptions that occurred notifying listeners. Null if none.

      • fireNotify

        List<ListenerExceptionEntry> fireNotify(EventObject event)
        Equivalent to fireNotify( event, 0 );
        Parameters:
        event - Event to be sent to listeners.
        Returns:
        List of any ListenerExceptionEntry recording the exceptions that occurred notifying listeners. Null if none.
        See Also:
        fireNotify(EventObject, int )
